abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated as
            satisfactory, and sustainability is rated likely. Both the
            overall performances of the World Bank and the Borrower are
            assessed as satisfactory. The following positive lessons
            have been learned from implementing the project: In
            countries with weak implementation capacity, similar
            services such as geological mapping, should preferably be
            always contracted as long as there is insufficient local
            capacity. The twinning arrangement with a geological survey
            from an important industrialized country contributed to the
            success of the arrangement. The small size of the unit and
            the unrestricted direct access of the coordinator to the
            Minister proved to be very efficient the team members worked
            as civil servants, performing coordinating and
            teaching/coaching tasks. The training projects executed
            under the project had a significant motivating effect, for
            the coordinating team as well as for the eligible staff from
            the Ministry. Motivation was not only induced by
            participation in foreign training but also by attending
            local courses. Negative lessons learned were these: Changes
            in civil servants' status cannot be achieved at the
            sector level, but rather as part of a major cross-sectoral
            operation. Lastly, inter-ministerial cooperation cannot be
            achieved without a special framework set up in advance.
